key_points: Gabby Petito's stepfather, James Schmidt, criticizes Brian Laundrie and his family's silence as 'unacceptable'.
Petito, 22, has been missing since she and Laundrie were traveling in Wyoming's Grand Teton National Park.
Petito was reported missing on September 11, 10 days after Laundrie returned home alone to Florida.
Laundrie has only communicated through a lawyer and has not provided information to the police.
Petito's family urges the Laundrie family to 'step up and do the right thing' by providing information.
Police named Laundrie as a person of interest in Petito's disappearance.
An incident involving the couple on August 12 was deemed a 'mental health crisis' by police.
Schmidt urges those who were in the same areas as Petito to review their photos for potential leads.
Petito and Laundrie documented their trip on social media until around the end of August.
James Schmidt, Petito's stepfather, has been actively involved in the search efforts in Wyoming.
